page.title: 08CHILDREN
page.content: 14 families in Meysey Hampton have children who attend Meysey Hampton School. 14 families have children either too young for school or who go to school elsewhere or who are too old for school. There is a Mother and Toddler Club which meets twice a week and a private nursery school for pre-school age children. Secondary school pupils travel by bus to Farmor's Comprehensive School in Fairford. The village school is a Church of England Controlled School which was built in 1872 and is now attended by 39 children. There is a Youth Club and a Cub Scout pack. There are Brownie and Guide companies in neighbouring villages.
